title: Singing Voice Synthesis Based on a Musical Note Position-Aware Attention Mechanism. (arXiv:2212.13703v2 [eess.AS] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper proposes a novel sequence-to-sequence (seq2seq) model with a musical note position-aware attention mechanism for singing voice synthesis (SVS). A seq2seq modeling approach that can simultaneously perform acoustic and temporal modeling is attractive. However, due to the difficulty of the temporal modeling of singing voices, many recent SVS systems with an encoder-decoder-based model still rely on explicitly on duration information generated by additional modules. Although some studies perform simultaneous modeling using seq2seq models with an attention mechanism, they have insufficient robustness against temporal modeling. The proposed attention mechanism is designed to estimate the attention weights by considering the rhythm given by the musical score. Furthermore, several techniques are also introduced to improve the modeling performance of the singing voice. translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种新颖的序列到序列（seq2seq）模型，该模型具有乐曲音符位置感知-注意机制，用于唱声合成（SVS）。尽管很多最近的SVS系统使用了编码器-解码器模型，但由于唱声的时间建模难度较大，它们仍然依赖于由其他模块生成的显式时长信息。虽然一些研究使用带有注意机制的seq2seq模型进行同时建模，但它们对于时间建模的鲁棒性不足。所提出的注意机制旨在通过考虑乐谱给出的节奏来估计注意力权重。此外，还引入了几种技术来提高唱声建模的性能。实验结果表明，所提出的模型在自然性和鲁棒性方面都非常有效。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新的序列到序列模型，该模型具有乐曲音符位置感知-注意机制，用于唱声合成。所提出的注意机制可以通过考虑音乐乐谱给出的节奏来估计注意力权重，实验结果表明该模型在自然性和鲁棒性方面都非常有效。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel seq2seq model with a musical note position-aware attention mechanism for singing voice synthesis. The proposed attention mechanism estimates attention weights by considering the rhythm given by the musical score. Experimental results show that the proposed model is effective in terms of both naturalness and robustness of singing voice synthesis.
